body: @xadupre Don't we return the result of decision_function in SVC if probability=False?

Currently no. Some explanations are in the documentation of the converter: https://github.com/onnx/sklearn-onnx/blob/master/skl2onnx/operator_converters/support_vector_machines.py#L17. scikit-learn had different raw scores than svmlib. There was a change in SVC scores in scikit-learn after I wrote this converter. It should be revisited.

I trained with **probability = "False"** and **decision_function_shape = "ovo"** in SVC. Please see attached. It seems no problem. Both sklearn (decision_function)and onnxruntime return same number of values (=45). 

On the other hands,  **decision_function_shape = "ovr"** returns different values. For example in case of digits data (10 classes), sklearn (decision_function) returns 10 elements , while onnxruntime returns 45 elements. Is it expected ?

[sample-notebook.zip](https://github.com/onnx/sklearn-onnx/files/3790115/sample-notebook.zip)

I implemented the converter before the following issue was fixed: https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/issues/13030 fixed in PR https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/pull/10440. I think it is now available in 0.21. Unfortunately, there is no easy way of fixing it in onnx. We either need to implement function _ovr_decision_function in ONNX or create an new operator.

issue.title: Issues in loading Sklearn's SVC model in scala/Java with ONXX

repository.name: tutorials
repository.description: Tutorials for creating and using ONNX models

issue.body:
For a demonstration of this issue, I have used IRIS as the data.
I have created models for IRIS data with sklearn's Randomforest, Logistic Regression and SVC and dumped all three using onxx library. 
Now while accessing the onxx models in scala the RF model and logistic-reg model works as expected

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54843933/127280588-604759af-f50d-4059-9b79-c70dcc0da60e.png)

Now while loading the SVC model trained and dumped in the same way it is giving some weird output as shown in the image and couldn't able to parse the results.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54843933/127280790-f21d91e7-3a27-4323-8eaf-28aaf71ff394.png)

(usually this happens when we print a java array. But this isn't a java array. Indexing causes error)

Initally had issues in saving svc model. Referred https://github.com/onnx/sklearn-onnx/issues/302 and was able to save the model. But now I am getting errors in parsing the output only in scala/Java. while loading the saved onnx model in Python the results were good as expected.

body:
Hello, I am trying to convert an SVC to ONNX with `skl2onnx-1.9.1` with raw scores, but it seems like it is not allowed. Is it possible to work around this limitation?

> NameError: Option 'raw_scores' not in ['nocl', 'zipmap'] for class 'SVC'.
